intro: Lisianthius scabridulus, commonly known as the rough lisianthus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, daisy-like flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine, rough hairs, giving the plant its common name. Lisianthius scabridulus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
